Description: Diademed head of Ptolemy I with aegis, right. (obverse)
Eagle standing on thunderbolt with wings closed, left; to left Λ Κ Α; to right, Π Α. (reverse)
State: Associated with: Kingdom of Egypt Ancient Greece and Rome: Kingdom of Egypt
Curator's comments: This coin appears to be a contemporary forgery. Made of base metal, it imitates the silver issue and may have been plated in antiquity. There is a similar example in the BM collection with silver plating still intact (BM C&M 1866,1201.3916; BMC Ptolemies p113.44).
Bibliographic references: SNG Copenhagen / Sylloge Nummorum Graecorum: The Royal Collection of coins and medals, Danish National Museum (43 vols) (631) (type)
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Ptolemy X Alexander I
